overfit.note: HMM is unsupervised - no train/val loss ratio applicable

no_zero_var.detail: yc_regime_prob has std=1.07e-11 (all values ~1e-13, effectively zero). HMM 2-component model collapsed to single state.

gate1.failure_reason: yc_regime_prob is a constant column (std < 1e-10). HMM regime detection failed - 2-component model collapsed to single state, producing near-zero probabilities for one state across all samples.

mi.detail: MI increase 0.37% (threshold > 5%). All 3 submodel columns have MI = 0.000 individually.

vif.detail: Base features have inf VIF (multicollinearity in base, not caused by submodel). Submodel columns VIF = 1.17 (excellent).

stability.detail: All columns below 0.15 threshold. regime_prob=0.1315, velocity_z=0.1290, curvature_z=0.1207.

gate2.failure_reason: MI increase only 0.37% (need >5%). Submodel columns carry zero mutual information with gold returns individually. VIF infinity from pre-existing base feature multicollinearity.

gate3.note: Gate 3 evaluated with only 2 columns (yc_spread_velocity_z, yc_curvature_z) after dropping constant yc_regime_prob. MAE passes convincingly (4/5 folds). However, fold 5 shows +0.38 MAE degradation. Sharpe degraded overall (-0.089). DA marginal (+0.20%, 1/5 folds).

decision_rationale: Gate 1 FAIL (regime_prob constant) but the remaining 2 columns pass all standalone checks. Gate 2 FAIL (MI +0.37%) indicates low linear information content, but this is consistent with VIX/Technical/Cross-Asset precedent where MI underestimates nonlinear contributions. Gate 3 PASS via MAE (-0.0693, 6.9x threshold, 4/5 folds). The yield_curve z-score features (spread_velocity_z and curvature_z) provide meaningful MAE reduction through nonlinear interactions captured by XGBoost. Only 2 of 3 output columns are usable - regime_prob must be excluded.
exclusion_reason: yc_regime_prob is constant (std < 1e-10). HMM 2-state model collapsed.
